findings.title: Integer Overflow / Underflow
findings.description: Integer overflow/underflow occur when an integer hits its bit-size limit. Every integer has a set range; when that range is passed, the value loops back around.

findings.title: Unchecked Return Value
findings.description: Most functions will return a `true` or `false` value upon success. Some functions, like `send()` , are more crucial to check than others. It's important to ensure that every necessary function is checked.

findings.title: Incorrect Check for permissioned_pair_address
findings.description: The function uniswap_v2_call() reverts if it's called by a permissioned_pair_address (line 98). This is likely incorrect.

findings.title: remove_liquidity_cspr() Differs from Uniswap's Implementation
findings.description: The function `remove_liquidity_cspr()` calls `transfer_from()` instead of `safeTransfer()` as in the original Uniswap implementation, causing tokens to be sent from the caller instead of the contract.

findings.title: mint_fee() Enables Fee Only When fee_to Is 0x0
findings.description: It appears to be an error in implementation of `mint_fee()` ; the fee would always be sent to 0x0.

findings.title: pair_for() Does Not Sort The Tokens Before Fetching a Pair
findings.description: `pair_for()` does not sort the tokens before fetching a pair. Consequently, it may contradict the assumptions that Uniswap users may have.

findings.title: Allowance Double-Spend Exploit
findings.description: The contract is vulnerable to the allowance double-spend exploit as with other ERC20 tokens.

findings.title: Race Conditions / Front-Running
findings.description: A producer attacker can take advantage of the ordering of transactions to manipulate the end result of a block by generating and moving transactions in a way that benefits themselves. Specifically, in the `mint_fee()` function located in `pair/src/pair.rs#L657`, the `treasury_fee` is used in calculation for the liquidity, however these variable can also be changed from the `set_treasury_fee()` function which can cause a race condition and result a miscalculation in the liquidity.

findings.title: Missing Verification on Some Variables
findings.description: In the add_liquidity() function, amount_a_desired and amount_b_desired variables are not verified, allowing anyone to inject these parameters with a value of 0.

findings.title: set_nonce() Adds an Arbitrary amount To The Nonce
findings.description: The function `set_nonce()` may add an arbitrary `amount` to the nonce.

findings.title: Functions skim() And sync() Are Re-entrant
findings.description: Unlike in Uniswap, both functions are re-entrant.
